author: __kasey__
content:
<@308223150725005322> brought up an interesting point re EL specs for 4844, re:
`blob_versioned_hashes: List[VersionedHash, MAX_VERSIONED_HASHES_LIST_SIZE]` MAX_VERSIONED_HASHES_LIST_SIZE is 2**24, so a single tx can carry a number of VersionedHashes that shoots significantly past the number of blobs that can be included in a block presently, and Presumably a tx cannot be included across multiple blocks, so the EL limit at runtime will always need to be at least the same as the CL limit. I'm guessing this is future proofing so we can raise limits without changing the EIP, with the intent of implementations setting a lower limit at first? Will this always be set to match the CL's `MAX_BLOBS_PER_BLOCK` (=4 currently) param?
